summary: Merges multiple SAM and/or BAM files into a single file.

arguments.summary: If true, assume that the input files are in the same sort order as the requested output sort order, even if their headers say otherwise.
arguments.name: --ASSUME_SORTED

arguments.summary: Comment(s) to include in the merged output file's header.
arguments.name: --COMMENT

arguments.summary: Compression level for all compressed files created (e.g. BAM and VCF).
arguments.name: --COMPRESSION_LEVEL

arguments.summary: Whether to create a BAM index when writing a coordinate-sorted BAM file.
arguments.name: --CREATE_INDEX

arguments.summary: Whether to create an MD5 digest for any BAM or FASTQ files created.
arguments.name: --CREATE_MD5_FILE

arguments.summary: Google Genomics API client_secrets.json file path.
arguments.name: --GA4GH_CLIENT_SECRETS

arguments.summary: SAM or BAM input file
arguments.name: --INPUT

arguments.summary: An interval list file that contains the locations of the positions to merge. Assume bam are sorted and indexed. The resulting file will contain alignments that may overlap with genomic regions outside the requested region. Unmapped reads are discarded.
arguments.name: --INTERVALS

arguments.summary: When writing files that need to be sorted, this will specify the number of records stored in RAM before spilling to disk. Increasing this number reduces the number of file handles needed to sort the file, and increases the amount of RAM needed.
arguments.name: --MAX_RECORDS_IN_RAM

arguments.summary: Merge the sequence dictionaries
arguments.name: --MERGE_SEQUENCE_DICTIONARIES

arguments.summary: SAM or BAM file to write merged result to
arguments.name: --OUTPUT

arguments.summary: Whether to suppress job-summary info on System.err.
arguments.name: --QUIET

arguments.summary: Reference sequence file.
arguments.name: --REFERENCE_SEQUENCE

arguments.summary: Sort order of output file
arguments.name: --SORT_ORDER

arguments.summary: One or more directories with space available to be used by this program for temporary storage of working files
arguments.name: --TMP_DIR

arguments.summary: Use the JDK Deflater instead of the Intel Deflater for writing compressed output
arguments.name: --USE_JDK_DEFLATER

arguments.summary: Use the JDK Inflater instead of the Intel Inflater for reading compressed input
arguments.name: --USE_JDK_INFLATER

arguments.summary: Option to create a background thread to encode, compress and write to disk the output file. The threaded version uses about 20% more CPU and decreases runtime by ~20% when writing out a compressed BAM file.
arguments.name: --USE_THREADING

arguments.summary: Validation stringency for all SAM files read by this program.  Setting stringency to SILENT can improve performance when processing a BAM file in which variable-length data (read, qualities, tags) do not otherwise need to be decoded.
arguments.name: --VALIDATION_STRINGENCY

arguments.summary: Control verbosity of logging.
arguments.name: --VERBOSITY

description:
This tool is used for combining SAM and/or BAM files from different runs or read groups into a single file, similar to the \"merge\" function of Samtools (http://www.htslib.org/doc/samtools.html).

Note that to prevent errors in downstream processing, it is critical to identify/label read groups appropriately. If different samples contain identical read group IDs, this tool will avoid collisions by modifying the read group IDs to be unique. For more information about read groups, see the GATK Dictionary entry.


Usage example:

 java -jar picard.jar MergeSamFiles \\

      I=input_1.bam \\

      I=input_2.bam \\

      O=output_merged_files.bam
name: MergeSamFiles
